episode.title: Boston Stock Exchange v. State Tax Commission

section.heading: Opinion Announcement of Justice Byron R. White

turn.speaker: warren_e_burger
turn.label: Chief Justice Warren E. Burger
turn.text: The judgments and opinion of the Court in 75-1019, Boston Stock Exchange against the State Tax Commission will be announced by Mr. Justice White.

turn.speaker: byron_r_white
turn.label: Justice Byron R. White
turn.text: This case involves a New York State tax on the transfer of security under the law of what you understand is the ex-rated glory of the sale that is involved and takes place in New York that it takes place out of state.
The out of state exchanges and challenge the tax in New York Courts.
The New York Court of Appeals sustained the tax against a -- against the challenge that is based on a Commerce Clause.
In our view, the tax does represent discriminatory burden on the interstate commerce and then precisely, the kind of evil in which the Commerce Clause was in.
